snippet: There is no question Mitt Romney went up in the polls after the first debate, but a close look at the numbers suggests that President Obama is still slightly ahead.
abstract: FiveThirtyEight blog notes that Mitt Romney's post-debate bounce has put him even or slightly ahead in national polls, despite fact that he remains behind in polls conducted in swing states; contends that on the whole, state data is usually a better indicator of electoral college performance.
lead_paragraph: There is no question Mitt Romney went up in the polls after the first debate, but a close look at the numbers suggests that President Obama is still slightly ahead.

headline.seo: Polls Show Gains for Romney After Debate
headline.main: A Bounce for Romney, but Just How High?
headline.print_headline: A Bounce for Romney, But Just How High?
